#summary How to build plugins with GCC
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy

 The following files are needed:

  http://sourceforge.net/projects/mingw/
  bison-2.3-MSYS-1.0.11-1.tar.bz2
  msysCORE-1.0.11-20080826.tar.gz
  binutils-2.19.1-mingw32-bin.tar.tar
  mingw32-make-3.81-20080326-3.tar.tar
  mingwrt-3.15.2-mingw32-dev.tar.tar
  mingw-utils-0.3.tar.gz
  w32api-3.13-mingw32-dev.tar.gz

 http://www.tdragon.net/recentgcc/
 gcc-4.4.0-tdm-1-core-2.zip
 gcc-4.4.0-tdm-1-g++-2.zip

 http://sourceforge.net/projects/re2c
 re2c-0.13.5-bin.zip

 Extract to *msys* folder:
 bison-2.3-MSYS-1.0.11-1.tar.bz2
 msysCORE-1.0.11-20080826.tar.gz

 Extract to *msys/bin* folder:
 re2c-0.13.5-bin.zip

 Extract to *mingw* folder:
 binutils-2.19.1-mingw32-bin.tar.tar
 mingw32-make-3.81-20080326-3.tar.tar
 mingwrt-3.15.2-mingw32-dev.tar.tar
 mingw-utils-0.3.tar.gz
 w32api-3.13-mingw32-dev.tar.gz
 gcc-4.4.0-tdm-1-core-2.zip
 gcc-4.4.0-tdm-1-g++-2.zip

 Add *mingw/bin* and *msys/bin* to *PATH*.

 Create a file called *fstab* under *msys/etc* with the following contents:
 _Drive:/path_to/mingw /mingw_

 Now, to compile the plugins you need to use the following command:
 _mingw32-make -f makefile WIDE=1 COMMON=../path_to_common/from_far_svn_

 Some plugins might require the CRT (*common/CRT*) lib from Far repository, it can be built as follows:
 _mingw32-make -f makefile_lib_gcc_
